thread.title: Dow's nearly 300-point tumble marks second-worst Friday in 2015
thread.title_full: Dow's nearly 300-point tumble marks second-worst Friday in 2015 - MarketWatch

author: Mark DeCambre
title: Dow's nearly 300-point tumble marks second-worst Friday in 2015
text: U.S. stocks got hammered Friday, but The Dow Jones Industrial Average really took it on the chin. The Dow DJIA, -1.74% suffered its second-worst Friday drop in 2015 on a point and percentage basis, according to Dow Jones data. Blue-chips tumbled 289 points, or 1.7%, to finish at 16,384.79, registering their worst close since Aug. 21, when the Dow plunged by 530 points, or 3.1%, to 16,459.75, fueled by worries about China's sluggish economy . This time around the stock-market rout was inspired by the Federal Reserve's decision to leave rates unchanged due to concerns about emerging-market economies like China. The other main indexes didn't fare much better. The S&P 500 SPX, -1.62% lost 32.12 points, or 1.6%, to close at 1,958.08, while the Nasdaq Composite Index COMP, -1.36% gave up 66.72 points, or 1.4%, to end the week at 4,827.23.
